plants.name: Narcissus pseudonarcissus
plants.description: A hardy perennial plant known for its bright yellow, trumpet-shaped flowers. It is often found in woodlands and meadows across Europe.
plants.location: Europe, particularly the UK and western Europe
plants.funFact: Wild daffodils were naturalized in ancient times and have been celebrated in poetry and folklore for centuries.

plants.name: Prunus serrulata
plants.description: Famous ornamental tree known for its stunning pink to white blossoms that create breathtaking spring landscapes, especially in Japan.
plants.location: Japan, East Asia, also cultivated worldwide
plants.funFact: Cherry blossom festivals (Hanami) in Japan mark the arrival of spring and have deep cultural significance.

plants.name: Erica arborea
plants.description: A shrub that produces small white to pale pink bell-shaped flowers. It typically grows in Mediterranean climate zones.
plants.location: Mediterranean Basin, parts of Africa and southern Europe
plants.funFact: Erica arborea wood is historically used to make smoking pipes due to its heat resistance.

plants.name: Calycanthus floridus
plants.description: A deciduous shrub native to the southeastern United States, with maroon to reddish-brown fragrant flowers that usually bloom in early spring.
plants.funFact: The aromatic flowers smell spicy and sweet, often compared to pineapple or strawberry.
